msContents.summary: The account contained in this text registers the receipt of payments both in money and in kind made by the grammateus Lucius to the anonymous writer. The payments are spread over the greater part of a year, but the nature of the service rendered is not specified. A word crucial in this connection has been virtually obliterated on the papyrus (line 4).

condition.ab: The left edge of the recto of his medium-brown papyrus, which is the left edge of the verso, is straight, as is also the bottom edge of the sheet. By contrast, the right edge of the recto in its upper half as well as the right half of the upper edge are badly damaged and irregular. A neatly made kollesis is visible on both sides of the papyrus.On the verso it passes midway through the few lines of the left-hand column. The width of the join is ca. 2.5 cm.

handDesc.p: The text of this account begins on the right half of the verso, where the writing runs across the fibers, and continues on the left half of the recto, where the writing is parallel with the fibers. The presence of modest margins above and below the text on both sides marks the account as complete. In the upper left portion of the verso are badly faded remnants of another account, and since the first line begins with all(), it is clear that these few lines conclude an account which occupied at least one more column now lost on the left side.

div.ab: "Account of the present 16th, 4, and 2nd year. Account of Lucius, scribe. He made a written undertaking for . . . of which the copy is on file. Of these, on Phaophi 29, I received from him 3000 silver drachmas; through Hatres, 6 keramia of wine; through the same, 2 3/4 artabas of wheat:;Hathyr 27, through the same, 3 more keramia of wine:;Tybi 24, through Kalipodias as a festival gift, 1 spathion of wine:;Mecheir 17, I received in addition 2000 silver drachmas:;Pharmouthi 15, there were sent to my mother on account of the price of wool, 2000 drachmas:;Pachon 23, I received from the same 1 talent 4500 drachmas; of these, from Dionysos, son of of Leonteus, 1 talent; from Dioskoros, banker, in the village of Sepho, 4500 drachmas:;and in the month Pauni, 1000 drachmas; as the price of bread, 300 drachmas:;in Mecheir, there was given by his mother, of dates, 1 mation; of white lentils, one-half mation; of chick-peas, one-half mation.;Total of the amounts given by him: in silver, 3 talent 800 drachmas; of wine, 9 keramia, 1 spathion; of wheat, 2 3/4 artabas; of white lentils, 1/2 mation; of chick-peas, 1/2 mation; of dates, 1 mation."
